result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cedric D Simpson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Cedric D Simpson not in court, in custody.  Attorney Paul Garland Bonneson in court for Cedric D Simpson.  Assistant District Attorney Chad Wozniak in court for the State of Wisconsin for Grant Huebner.  The Court waived defendants appearance.  Defense requests a date for projected guilty plea.  Case remains calendared in Br 45.  mn
Plea hearing scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Cedric D Simpson not in court, in custody.  Attorney Paul Garland Bonneson in court for Cedric D Simpson.  Attorney Grant Ian Huebner in court for State of Wisconsin. With the Court's permission, this matter is scheduled off the record.  At the request of defense and with no objection from the State, this matter is adjourned for an additional scheduling conference in Br 45.  mn
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Cedric D Simpson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Paul Garland Bonneson appeared by video for Cedric D Simpson.  Attorney Grant Ian Huebner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State:  MPD Officer   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 45.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Cedric D Simpson in court with attorney Paul Garland Bonneson.  Defendant Cedric D Simpson in custody, appeared via video.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Victim's Advocate and Victim's family members appear via video.  J. Chesser makes statement to the court. Bail motion by defense argued and DENIED by the Court. Cash Bond shall remain as previously set. All conditions remain the same.
Case adjourned to Br. PE for Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Cedric D Simpson in court, in custody CJF (quarantine).  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Tom Reed appears for OSPD.  There is an SPD conflict however, they are confident to appointment is likely.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Cedric D Simpson in court, in custody. Attorney Thomas Reed appeared for the State Public Defender's Office. Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cedric D Simpson appeared by video means.
Case in court for a State V Lee Hearing. Defendant appears without counsel. Due to a conflict of interest, SPD has not found counsel to appoint at this time. SPD is making efforts to appoint counsel from their Private counsel listings. No one has accepted the case at this time. Court found good cause in the SPD efforts and adjourns matter for a status of counsel/bail review. Case remains calendared in Br. 34.  Status conference scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Cedric D Simpson not in court, defendant in custody.  Michael Schindhelm appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests that this matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing in the trial court. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a State V. Lee hearing in Br. 34.  Hearing scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Cedric D Simpson in court with attorney Theodore OReilly.  Defendant Cedric D Simpson in custody.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
